column4: so uh, can someone help a recent windows user with network issue? last night a new kernal got everything work peachy. Now, in the morning a reboot later, even the wired doesn't work.
what is the problem? can you be a bit more descriptive?
what kind of network card / computer are you using?
it's a dell inspiron 6400, broadcom bcm 4401 eth, bcm 4311 wlan
just looking into that card... what version of ubuntu (or kernel) are you running?
are you cards being recognised at all? in a terminal try: lspci - are they listed? and if so, what info do you get from: ifconfig ?
how about if you type: lsmod - does it come up there?
what did you do to install it originally? did it just work, or did you have to run some "modprobe" commands?
did you install ssb or ndiswrapper or something like that? eth0 doesn't disappear for the fun of it :)

I'm not sure why anything would have changed after a reboot, I guess it depends on what network settings / stuff you installed when it was working... it might be worth trying: modprobe b44 - but I am just guessing without knowing more info about how it started :\
try sudo modprobe -r ssb b44 - and then sudo modprobe b44
yeah, apparently ssb causes probs with wired on that card
you might want to check /etc/modules to see if it's set to auto load on boot (if it is, get rid of it)
this article might solve your problem: http://gf4e.wordpress.com/2008/04/28/ndiswrapper-and-ssb-conflict/
and KE1HA - thanks so much. After several reboots, both wired and wireless now wok automatically upon boot, with a minor edit to the /etc/modules, etc. Thanks!!!!
